author: Randstad USA
title: How Can AI-Powered Financial Forecasting Improve Accuracy? | Randstad USA
text: People are capable of some incredible feats, but seeing into the future is not one of them. However, recent advancements in AI technologies, like machine learning, are now accessible and affordable — and in a financial expert’s hands, they can be used to lessen the unpredictable nature of financial forecasting and propel your business forward. Using tools like AI can help you compete with and surpass your competition. AI removes barriers in financial planning Even the most experienced financial professionals are limited in the amount of data they can locate, analyze and apply to the needs of their clients. Artificial intelligence removes this barrier in many important ways, by assessing massive and diverse datasets, detecting patterns and trends, and adapting to changing market conditions in real time. Accurately scrutinizing past data makes financial forecasting more predictable. Knowing what has happened previously makes it easier to predict the future, and when AI is used by a finance expert, its impact on businesses can be immediate and substantial. AI-powered financial forecasting can help your business Not only can AI enable fast data processing while analyzing vast amounts of historical and real-time data, it can also adapt to multiple factors at once, depending on your company’s specific needs. AI uses algorithms to identify hidden financial patterns within data. Imagine the positive implications this can have. Your financial expert uses this information to inform strategic decisions and risk management. It means your business can respond quickly to evolving market conditions. At the same time, your company can tweak its financial strategies using AI-driven models and forecasts. Whether assessing market volatility, credit defaults, social media and news trends and supply chain disruptions or managing cash flow and predicting revenue growth, AI offers invaluable guidance and insight. This can lessen your company’s financial risk and increase profitability. These are just some of the benefits of putting a financial pro on your team. There are more. even more advantages for your business In 2024, using AI tools in finance is critical for optimizing operations and ensuring competitiveness and flexibility. A finance professional skilled in AI relies on the data for more accurate, reliable predictions and improving overall decision-making. With AI, your finance expert gains crucial insights that may be overlooked if the same work was performed manually. In addition, as with many of today’s technological tools, using AI is highly efficient and frees up time for your employees to focus on other important tasks for your company. work with a trusted partner Hiring a professional who can harness AI’s ability to help with the unpredictability of financial forecasting is pivotal for your company, offering accuracy, agility and efficiency in the financial decision-making processes. By counting on Randstad as a [strategic partner](https://www.randstadusa.com/get-in-touch/) and employing one of our proven experts, you can greatly benefit from putting professionals and AI to work for your business.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Dogs in snow! Colorado's pups enjoy the storm
text:
By Katie Parkins ,
6 hours ago While it's a snow day for many of Colorado's humans, both young and old, their furry friends are also enjoying the storm.
Maybe as much as the children, "This little Pomsky is loving the snowday!" Gemma Hanekom said.
Rebecca Seib and her pup went for a walk Thursday morning in Lakewood's Union Ridge Park.
"Crazy snow amounts! Over 18+ inches!" Seib said in her post on Denver7's Discover Colorado Through Your Photos Facebook group, noting she brought a tape measure with them on their stroll.
"The crazy thing is my dogs paws couldn't even reach the sidewalk!" Seib said in her post.
But this pup didn't seem to mind, shoving its snoot straight into the snow.
Impressive snow totals popping up in Florissant, Colorado in Teller County, just barely missing 2 feet when Claudia Ädams posted this photo of her trudging through the snow up to its belly.
In Castle Rock on Ridge Road, Michelle Rhea Karamooz sent us this video of letting her dogs outside.
The duo was just having so much fun, Karamooz asked Lily to lead her brother Luke back indoors. The pup came trotting in with a fresh layer of snow stuck to his back, seemingly without a care in the world.
Michelle Rhea Karamooz.mp4 Looking at the table in her yard, Karamooz said she estimated there was about 16 inches of accumulation.
In Genesee Park, Erik Lassi snapped this photo of his pup waiting patiently to come back inside. Despite the inches of snow stacked up in the yard, this dog managed to only get a sprinkling on its back.
Erik Lassi Laura C. Keuhl told us she's seeing around 2 feet of snow in North Evergreen, which was just about as tall as their Australia Shepherd wading through the backyard. The pup got back to the door with a flare, bouncing through the approximately 24 inches.
Australia Shepherd in North Evergreen wades into snow Denver7's Angelika Albaladejo took this video of her dog Maya playing with her ball in the snow in Lakewood.
Denver7's Angelika Albaladejo plays with her dog in the snow Dave Bader shared this video with Denver7 on Instagram of his pup traipsing through the snow in Highlands Ranch. You could almost lose his dog in the snow, especially as it dives headfirst into a pile.
DAVE BADER.mp4 In south Castle Rock, Kathy McQueary's dog has a special talent sitting on top of all that snow without sinking.
Kathy McQueary While Carolina's dog was nearly up to its chest in the snow in Castle Rock.
Carolina Meet Boon from Longmont. Allison Sendziak said Boon was enjoying the fresh snow Thursday, even though it may not look like it.
Allison Sendzia No matter the size, the pups were out and about Thursday. This 13-week old-puppy Maggi got to experience 18 inches of snow and counting in Highlands Ranch.
Jennifer Mravich Maggi's in good company.
Snuffkin, Daisy Geasland's 11-month-old Springer Spaniel, wanted to help shovel the driveway with her paw-rents in southeast Aurora.
"The snow is one Snufkin deep," Geasland said.
While this pup's name may be Autumn, she's looking like she's made for winter. Karoline told Denver7, Autumn was loving playing in the snow in their West Highlands backyard.
Karoline You'd think it was summer though with the way Madison Mcfarland Elwell's Collie was laying out in the snow.
"She is loving this weather" in Old Town Lafayette, Colorado, Elwell said
"Where's Waldo?" If you look really closely, you'll be able to spot Josie Rhoads-Verbeek's dog sticking out from underneath 12 inches of snow in Arvada.
Josie Rhoads-Verbeek This fluff ball is "Up to snow good" in Centennial, Colorado, Karen Dyroff said in the Denver7 Discover Colorado Through Your Photos Facebook group.
Colorado snow totals? "Dachshund size!" Lynn Lynn said in a post on Denver7's Discover Colorado Through Your Photos Facebook group.
Who needs the Metric System when you can measure in pups per square foot?
There's "one Corgi of snow in Golden, CO!" Cecillia Sanders said.
"Where you lead, I will follow...," Jennifer Deherrera's dogs told her, leaving a trail of tiny paw prints through Thursday's snow.
Jennifer Deherra Colorado's dogs (and their owners) are getting creative in the snow "riding the storm out in Boulder," Jocasta Captures said.
In Elizabeth, Colorado, "Meadow and Juniper give this storm up!!!" Patti Yoensky said in her post on Denver7's Discover Colorado Through Your Photos Facebook page.
But it's not just the dogs taking in Thursday's delivery from Jack Frost.
We've got some Colorado cats venturing out in the snow.
"My other cat doesn’t want to go out in the snow as much..smart! Love my kitty boys!" Eadin Reid said in a post on Denver7's Discover Colorado Through Your Photos Facebook page.
DENVER WEATHER LINKS: Hourly forecast | Radars | Traffic | Weather Page | 24/7 Weather Stream

author: CBS2 Staff
title: Dog rescued from hot car in Boise Walmart parking lot - NewsBreak
text:
Post Register
website
Boise
Dog rescued from hot car in Boise Walmart parking lot
By CBS2 Staff,
1 days agoBOISE, Idaho — A dog was rescued from a dangerously hot car in the Walmart Overland parking lot after being left inside for more than 30 minutes. Authorities responded to a call reporting the dog locked in the vehicle on Monday afternoon, panting heavily, with the temperature inside reaching a staggering 142 degrees. The dog had no water or relief, and there was no sign of the owner.
4

author: @Vijestime
title: DPS: PES and Democrats organized a pre-election meeting at the Elementary School in Barutana, Jakšić Stojanović to resign
text: Representatives of the current government in Podgorica continue to abuse state resources during the election campaign. The latest example of this is the organization of a pre-election meeting of the coalition "Europe Now-Democrats - Even Stronger - Prof. Dr. Saša Mujović" with the residents of Lješanska nahija in the premises of the elementary school "Savo Kažić" in Barutana, announced the Democratic Party of Socialists (DPS). of the capital city. "The fact that the Minister of Education, Science and Innovation, Anđela Jakšić Stojanović, is in the front row at the mentioned meeting, who in this way sends a message to the public that the fundamental law for the field of education should be passed. - The general law on education and upbringing, which, among other things, prescribes that political activity and organizing, as well as the use of educational institutions for political purposes, is expressly prohibited, does not apply to her," the announcement states. They called on Jakšić Stojanović to take the burden of responsibility for the "brutal violation of the law and show a minimum of ethics by submitting his irrevocable resignation from the position of Minister of Education". "...And the competent institutions should finally deal with the supervision of the implementation of the Law on the Financing of Political Entities and Election Campaigns, because the previous results of the Agency for the Prevention of Corruption are not sufficient to improve the legality of the electoral process in Montenegro," the announcement concludes. Bonus video:

author: John Ross Ferrara
title: Winter Weather Advisory: Freezing rain forecast for the Hood River Valley
text:
KOIN Winter Weather Advisory: Freezing rain forecast for the Hood River Valley John Ross Ferrara Fri, December 13, 2024 at 6:14 PM UTC 1 min read
PORTLAND, Ore. ( KOIN ) — Freezing rain is in the forecast for the upper Hood River Valley and areas of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest Friday as heavy rain, mountain snow and frigid temperatures hit the region.
Five animals rescued from house fire in Vancouver
The National Weather Service has issued a winter weather advisory for the upper Hood River Valley and areas of the Cascade Range between Willamette Pass and the Canadian border from 10 a.m. Friday to 2 a.m. Saturday.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement “As [the rain] falls, it freezes and accumulates as ice,” the National Weather Service forecast states. “In this case, the freezing rain will be spotty but based on high resolution models, there is high confidence is accumulations of one tenth of an inch of ice throughout the valley.”
The freezing rain may cause slick roads and walkways. People traveling by road or by food are advised to use extra caution in areas where freezing rain is forecast.

author: Jesse T. Jackson
title: Donald Trump Tells Joe Biden, Others To ‘Rot in Hell’ in Christmas Message
text:
Former President
Donald Trump raised eyebrows Monday (Dec. 25) when he told a handful of people who he believes are “looking to destroy our once great USA” to “rot in hell” before wishing them a “merry Christmas.”
The 45th President of the United States posted his statement on Truth Social, the social media platform he founded in 2021 after he was permanently suspended from Jack Dorsey’s Twitter and Mark Zuckerberg’s Facebook following the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riots. The media giants alleged that Trump was using his platform to “incite violence.”
Nearly two years later, Twitter’s new owner, Elon Musk,
lifted Trump’s ban, allowing his more than 59,000 tweets to viewed by his now 87.4 million followers. However, although Trump’s suspension was lifted, the former president has chosen only to use Truth Social.
RELATED:
‘Trump Comes Up Short’—Former Trump Supporter Wayne Grudem Now Calls for Him To ‘Back Out Now’
Facebook lifted its ban of Trump in January 2023. That page is run by the “Donald J. Trump for President” 2024 campaign staff.
Truth Social has approximately 2 million active users, compared to Twitter, which is now called X and has over 525 million users. Facebook has 3.03 billion monthly active users.
Trump’s Christmas message specifically mentioned President Joe Biden and special counsel Jack Smith.
“Merry Christmas to all,” Trump wrote, “including Crooked
Joe Biden’s
RELATED:
As Trump Campaign Continues To Ramp up, So Does God-Talk
The GOP presidential favorite and professing Christian then mentioned world leaders, zeroing in on people he believes have set out to destroy America and wishing for them to spend an eternity in hell.
“Included also are World Leaders,” Trump added, “both good and bad, but none of which are as evil and ‘sick’ as the THUGS we have inside our Country who, with their Open Borders, INFLATION, Afghanistan Surrender, Green New Scam, High Taxes, No Energy Independence, Woke Military, Russia/Ukraine, Israel/Iran, All Electric Car Lunacy, and so much more, are looking to destroy our once great USA.
“
MAY THEY ROT IN HELL,” Trump continued. “AGAIN, MERRY CHRISTMAS!”

author: Eco-Business
title: Schneider Electric urges PH data centres to implement sustainable solutions to minimise energy consumption | Press Releases | Asia | Sustainable Business
text: Schneider Electric, the leader in energy management and digital automation, underscores the importance of a green approach to data centre design and operations to future-proof operations and lessen carbon emissions. This will make the industry more sustainable and resilient to growing demands. The company recently gathered data centre industry players to discuss today’s data landscape and challenges in an event called Power Up: Fuel Your Path For Success. Uptime Institute, an international research organisation on global data centres, estimated a 500 per cent growth in data generated from 2019-2025 all over the world. As its operations are energy-intensive, the data centre industry is estimated to account for 1 per cent of global electricity consumption. “Data centres have become integral to our rapidly growing internet economy. The need to transition to sustainable operations has become more pronounced,” said Carlos Leviste, Business Development and Marketing Director at Schneider Electric Philippines. He added that industries have previously leaned heavily on fuel alone to run their operations. As data centre facilities are energy-intensive, data centres play a pivotal role in sustainability. The most efficient way would be to shift to electricity and digital. However, there is a growing preference across industries for maximizing energy management systems and digital tools, which not only drive operational efficiency but also promote sustainability. Data centres, equipped with smarter operations, can optimise costs, speed, and capital to prepare them for future technological integrations and risk mitigation. Schneider Electric is at the forefront of this advancement with its extensive suite of digital solutions to improve the efficiency and sustainability of data centres. For instance, APC, Schneider Electric’s flagship brand, offer high-efficiency uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), cooling units, and monitoring systems to foresee any unwanted downtime within the data centres and pinpoint inefficiencies to their operations. In particular, the oil-free cooling centrifugal compressors with magnetic bearings chiller systems that Schneider Electric utilises allows data centres to consume power more efficiently and sustainably. Similarly, Schneider Electric provides renewable Power & Grid solutions that can help produce electricity sustainably to fuel data centre facilities’ increasing needs. “Through these solutions, data centre facilities can reduce operational costs in design and engineering, function using grid-compliant assets and software with reduced cybersecurity risks and ensure proactive maintenance of assets to maintain optimum uninterrupted performance,” said Sara El Fanidi, Power and Grid Sales Leader of Schneider Electric APAC. Furthering its commitment to sustainable digital transformation, Schneider Electric has also introduced new industry certifications within its EcoXpert™ Partner Program. These certifications are aimed at empowering partners to become trusted advisors on Data Center and Critical Infrastructure solutions, ensuring data centres are not only efficient and resilient but also sustainable. By harnessing the power of digital transformation and connected infrastructure, Schneider Electric is setting a new standard for data centres — one that prioritises sustainability, reliability, efficiency, and resilience in the face of rapidly changing demands. author: Jacky
title: Teenager’s body is pulled from frigid waters after four teens – ages 15 to 17 – fell through the ice in Ottawa as another remains missing
text:
The lifeless body of a teenager was recovered from the frigid waters of the Rideau River in Ottawa, Canada, after four friends fell through the ice Wednesday night.
17-year-old Ahmed Haitham was confirmed dead, a 15-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy were rushed to hospital, and a 16-year-old boy remains missing after hours of overnight search efforts.
The tragedy unfolded when four companions fell through the ice near Nicholls Island Road around 9:30 p.m., approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
The teens had planned to skate on the river, but the ice had been steadily melting due to warmer-than-average weather, as temperatures rose above freezing over the past week.
Two of the youths were successfully rescued and transported to the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario for treatment for mild hypothermia.
The lifeless body of a teenager was recovered from the frigid waters of the Rideau River in Ottawa, Canada, after four friends fell through the ice Wednesday night.
17-year-old Ahmed Haitham (pictured) was confirmed dead, a 15-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy were rushed to hospital, and a 16-year-old boy remains missing after hours of overnight search efforts .
The tragedy unfolded when four companions fell through the ice near Nicholls Island Road (pictured) around 9:30 p.m., approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
The Rideau River flows 91 miles from Upper Rideau Lake in eastern Ontario to the Ottawa River. The body was found near Nicholls Island Road, approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
Meanwhile, a police diver was sent to hospital for what paramedics described as “a diving-related emergency.”
Ottawa Police said early Thursday morning: “Members of the Ottawa Police Service and emergency crews were called to Nicolls Island Road last night following reports of four youths who had fallen through the ice in the Rideau River.”
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, they added. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
“Police divers later recovered the body of one of the missing youths,” according to authorities.
“The search for the second young man had to be suspended overnight and will begin this morning,” they added.
The Rideau River flows 91 miles from Upper Rideau Lake in eastern Ontario to the Ottawa River.
The famous Rideau Canal, located upstream along the river, is transformed during the winter into the largest skating rink in the world.
The skating season depends on the weather, but typically runs from January to early March. The skating rink is currently closed.
Haitham, the youngest of four siblings in his family, was a month away from turning 18.
The famous Rideau Canal, located upstream along the river, transforms into the world’s largest skating rink during the winter.
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, police said. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, they added. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
Haitham, the youngest of the four children in his family, was one month away from turning 18, according to reports
CBC.
The teenager’s father, Haitham Mohammed, and his aunt Faten Ataallah were at the scene waiting to see his body.
The family moved to Canada as refugees from Iraq a decade ago, Ataallah said. “They were excited to start a new beginning.”
Ataallah said Haitham hoped to attend a post-secondary police fundamentals program after graduating from John McRae High School in February of next year.
On Wednesday afternoon, Haitham left the family home to go skating with three friends, but never returned.
“We were all screaming,” Ataallah said. “It’s really hard. We can’t describe it. This is the worst feeling ever.”
Meanwhile, a police diver was sent to hospital for what paramedics described as “a diving-related emergency.”
On Wednesday afternoon, Haitham left the family home to go skating with three friends but never returned.
A GoFundMe page has been set up for Haitham and has raised more than C$8,000 as of Thursday afternoon.
“Ahmed Haitham was a teenager who was graduating in February 2024, aspired to become a police officer and was even being recruited,” the fundraising page reads.
“Just a few nights after a green Christmas, the ice was melting due to warmer weather,” he says.
‘When he got to the river and put on his skates, he only took a few steps on the ice and unfortunately the ice broke.
‘Ahmed and his friends fought for their lives wearing heavy winter pants and jackets, with heavy skates trying to swim in total darkness.
‘Ahmed was an incredible swimmer and could defend himself and save someone too. He in the cold water fighting to save his friends and his own life.
‘Unfortunately, Ahmed and one of his friends did not manage to escape.
“Ahmed’s parents are still in shock and call him by name and ask, ‘Oh Ahmed, where did you go?'” the organizer wrote.
‘As you know, rising costs, high mortgages/rents and food prices are expensive. The family needs your help during this difficult time that all Canadians are going through with our economy.’

author: Galiciae
title: Galicia: la menos 'enganchada' a Internet de toda España
text: Galicia destaca, aunque no precisamente para bien –según como se mire–, en el uso de [Internet](/tags/internet/). A pesar de que el 92,5% de los gallegos de entre 16 y 74 años navegó por la red en los últimos tres meses, esta cifra está por debajo de la media nacional (95,8%) y muy lejos de comunidades como Madrid o Cataluña, donde la cifra supera el 97%. Y lo curioso es que Galicia también lidera el ranking de los "menos enganchados": solo el 86,9% de los gallegos usa Internet al menos cinco días a la semana, el porcentaje más bajo de todo el país junto a Asturias. ¿A qué se debe este fenómeno? La dispersión geográfica, el envejecimiento de la población y el menor desarrollo de infraestructuras tecnológicas en algunas áreas rurales pueden ser factores claves. Galicia sigue sin sucumbir del todo a la conexión constante, y aquí, la desconexión, al parecer, tiene su propio atractivo. Compras online: con un pie en el freno ¿Y cómo van los gallegos en cuanto al comercio online? Pues con algo de cautela. Solo el 53,6% de los gallegos realizó compras en Internet en los últimos tres meses, un porcentaje por debajo de la media estatal del 56,7%. Aunque aumenta ligeramente año tras año, Galicia se mantiene más tradicional en sus hábitos de consumo, y prefiere el contacto físico, sin renunciar del todo a pasear por el comercio de barrio. A nivel nacional, la moda encabeza las compras online: ropa, calzado y accesorios son los favoritos, seguidos de entradas para eventos y entregas de comida rápida. Sin embargo, en la comunidad gallega, esta tendencia de consumo virtual parece avanzar sin prisa, pero ojo, sin pausa. Los jóvenes gallegos, con menos móvil que el resto de España En un mundo cada vez más digitalizado, donde muchos niños y jóvenes están constantemente pegados a pantallas y bombardeados por información, Galicia destaca con una tendencia diferente: menos dependencia de los teléfonos móviles entre los más jóvenes. Con solo el 63,4% de los gallegos entre 10 y 15 años usando este dispositivo, la comunidad se sitúa entre las que menos temprano introduce a sus menores al entorno digital. Este panorama sugiere que los niños gallegos disfrutan de más tiempo para explorar otras formas de entretenimiento y aprendizaje. Es más probable encontrarlos en el parque, jugando cara a cara y conectando con otros niños, en lugar de mirar una pantalla. En Galicia, los estímulos naturales siguen teniendo su espacio frente al avance tecnológico, ofreciendo una infancia con menos pantallas y más interacción directa. Con lo cual, este dato podría verse de forma positiva. Más cara a cara, menos teletrabajo El teletrabajo, a pesar de su auge durante la pandemia, todavía no despega en Galicia al ritmo de otras comunidades como Madrid, donde casi un 27% de los empleados trabaja desde casa. En Galicia, el trabajo telemático es menos frecuente, reflejando un vínculo con el trabajo presencial que, por el momento, no cede. Es que, ¡menudo gusto ver a tus compañeros en la oficina! Conectividad en casa y banca online: puntos a favor Eso sí, no todo son datos bajos: el 95,1% de los hogares gallegos ya tiene [conexión](https://www.elprogreso.es/articulo/comarcas/80-concellos-lugo-conectado-fibra-optica-adamo/202407181425001773621.html) a Internet, cada vez más cerca de la media nacional, y ocho de cada diez gallegos usan la banca electrónica, superando la media estatal. Aunque Galicia tenga una relación algo distante con la conectividad diaria, la comunidad avanza en otros aspectos digitales, especialmente en la gestión financiera online. ¿Desconexión o equilibrio? Galicia se desmarca como una de las comunidades menos digitalizadas, pero con un perfil único que muestra que, en la era de la hiperconexión, no todos los caminos llevan a la pantalla.
